main event: A round object reported in Clarksville, Iowa on 27 December 1957 that disappeared behind clouds.
interesting points: The object was first sighted stationary before it fluttered and emitted a rusty or amber light,The object's behavior included splitting into two objects after moving straight,The sighting lasted over 1 minute,There were conflicting comments suggesting it might be an aircraft or a possible balloon,The object was described as slightly larger than a star and moving at approximately 600 mph.
witness description: Robert Nuzio, Radar Operator, 15TR Air Force
